page.title: 15CHANGING TIMES
page.content: By{1965}there were no shops left. The water still came from a spring. The school was about the same size as it is today. Electricity had been installed. People began to do every kind of work because there were cars to take them further afield. In 1965, the milkman came round in his milk van delivering milk. There were two new bungalows built in Crowan. There was no blacksmith but the forge was later used as a pottery.The mills were still used and the looms in them were working too. A few years later, the mill closed down. In 1957 a farm for battery reared chickens was opened. The same farm also grows bulbs in many of the neighbouring fields and markets early{spring} {flowers.}
